intro: Zygogynum mackeei subsp. paniense, commonly known as the Panié zygogynum, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its unique morphological features, including its hairy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests or montane regions. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and potential ecological role in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and limited study, it remains a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
